required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Removal of Massive Subretinal Organized Blood Clot With Fragmatome
clinical_study.official_title: Removal of Massive Subretinal Organized Blood Clot With Fragmatome

brief_summary.textblock: By using the ultrasound power delivered by fragmatome, the hard, organized blood clot could be removed easily.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before operation, 1 weeks after operation, 1 month after operation.
primary_outcome.description: visual acuity change in logMAR in different time point
spherical power + half of cylinder power

intervention.description: Patients with massive subretinal hemorrhage from age related macular degeneration and organized subretinal blood clot were managed by inferior retinectomy. The subretinal organized blood clot was dragged to the preretinal space and removed by fragmatome. The retinal was reattached with perfluorocarbon liquid and laser was applied at the margin of retinectomy. Silicon oil was infused at the end of surgery.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with massive subretinal hemorrhage from age related macular degeneration and organized subretinal blood clot were managed by inferior retinectomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with massive subretinal hemorrhage from age related macular degeneration
- Patients had organized subretinal blood clot were managed by inferior retinectomy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients without massive subretinal hemorrhage
- Patients were not age related macular degeneration.
